alert.note: Alert for Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 25 at 7:21PM EDT until September 26 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albany NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Wappingers Creek At Wappingers Falls affecting Dutchess County. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wappingers Creek at Wappingers Falls. * WHEN...Into the overnight hours. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding and water begins to flood nearby homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Wappingers Creek Wappingers Falls Flood Stage: 8.0 Observed Stage at Mon 6 pm: 7.7 Forecast: Mon 8 pm 8.0 Tue 2 am 7.8 Tue 8 am 7.4 Tue 2 pm 7.1 Tue 8 pm 6.8 Wed 2 am 6.4 Wed 8 am 5.9 Wed 2 pm 5.4 Wed 8 pm 5.1 Thu 2 am 5.0 Thu 8 am 4.8 Thu 2 pm 4.8 &&
